Excellent meal here.  We showed up around 1 pm without a reservation and were seated at the bar.  The place was jampacked by the time we left.  The service wasn't terribly helpful, but everything we had was excellent, so I still recommend it.  It's Michelin recommended as well. The pan con tomate was the best we've had in Barcelona (a bit more drizzle most likely).  The razor clams were delicious - not chewy at all, with a light but tasty combination of olive oil and lemon.  The asparagus with fresh garlic had scallions that were chewy, but my friends enjoyed this dish more than I did.  We also ordered the one-piece montaditos - I thought the foie was excellent, while my friends thought the brie was okay.  The food seemed better even than Cal-pep!
